original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down at open, rupee at 291.00/292.50 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bonds were down at open on Wednesday, and the Spot US dollar opened at 291.50/292.50 rupees ahead of a t-bill auction, dealers said.
The Spot US dollar closed at 291.50/292.50 rupees rupees on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 23.90/24.10 percent down from 24.00/10 percent a day earlier, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 24.15/25.30 percent down from 25.00/50 percent a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 26.00/30 percent, steady from 26.00/50 percent on Tuesday.
140,000 million rupees treasury bills are to be issued through an auction on Wednesday.
